etymology.description: phonetic: 巾 + semantic: 攴; left-side later evolved into 㡀 with dots indicating dust/dirt.
etymology.interpretation: Cloth (巾) supplies the sound and evokes fabric, while 攴 marks an action, suggesting beating or wearing down. The dotted cloth form (㡀) visually hints at dusty, grimy fabric, aligning with senses like worn, tattered, and damaged.

examples.chinese: 敝人有些话想说(敝人有些話想說)。
examples.english: I, your humble self, have something to say.

examples.chinese: 这件衣服已经很敝旧了(這件衣服已經很敝舊了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfu yǐjīng hěn bìjiù le.
examples.english: This piece of clothing is already very worn-out.

examples.chinese: 如有打扰，还望见谅，敝处致歉(如有打擾，還望見諒，敝處致歉)。
examples.pinyin: Rú yǒu dǎrǎo, hái wàng jiànliàng, bì chù zhìqiàn.
examples.english: If there was any disturbance, we at our humble place apologize.
